reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Improving health services access to strengthen the sustainability and quality of the national TB and HIV response

description.narrative: Lao (Peoples Democratic Republic) - TB/HIV - Ministry of Health of the Lao People's Democratic Republic - MOH. This program has the following goals: End the transmission of HIV and limit the impact of HIV/AIDS and STI in Lao PDR by 2030.. To find the missed TB cases in order to reach the END TB targets by 2025 (75% reduction in mortality, 50% reduction in incidence compared to 2015 levels and zero catastrophic cost for TB patients and families.. The objectives of this program are: HIV Objective 1: Strengthen an enabling environment for an effective HIV/AIDS and STI response.. HIV Objective 2: Improve access to quality prevention services.. HIV Objective 3: Increase access to quality testing, treatment and care services.. TB Objective 1. Prevention of TB infection and disease. TB Objective 2. Increased population access to more sensitive TB screening and diagnosis. Objective 3. Improved Treatment of drug sensitive and drug resistant tuberculosis. Objective 4. Strengthen TB/HIV collaborative activities. Objective 5. Integration of TB prevention and care in primary health care
